title: Thousands overwhelm New York's Union Square for streamer giveaway, tossing chairs and pounding cars
text: A crowd of thousands that packed Manhattan's Union Square for a popular livestreamer's hyped giveaway got out of hand Friday afternoon, with some clambering on vehicles, hurling chairs and throwing punches, leaving police struggling to rein in the chaos.

title: ARM & HAMMER™ Becomes the First Major Laundry Detergent Brand in the Sheets Detergent Category on Amazon in the U.S. and Partners with Victoria Justice on the Innovative Launch
text: EWING, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--ARM & HAMMER™ Introduces Power Sheets Laundry Detergent, a Mess-Free Laundry Innovation with No More Plastic Bottles and Concentrated Cleaning Power.

title: The Score: Yellow, Advanced Micro Devices, Amazon and More Stocks That Defined the Week
text: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week's news

title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Stocks Lose Ground as Hiring Slows
text: The S&P 500 fell 0.5% on Friday, Aug. 4, 2023, after the Labor Department's latest jobs report showed the pace of hiring slowed.

title: Amazon set to launch credit card in Brazil with Bradesco
text: Amazon.com will launch a credit card offering in Brazil, in a partnership with Brazilian lender Banco Bradesco SA , the bank's chief executive said on Friday, as the ecommerce giant pushes to expand its fintech offering.

title: Amazon's stock chart's opening ‘gap' is the biggest in more than 9 months
text: The big jump in ecommerce giant Amazon.com Inc.'s stock AMZN, +9.29% Friday in the wake of second-quarter results, suggests investors were the most surprised by Amazon news in more than nine months. The 9.4% upside gap in the stock chart, between Thursday's closing price of $128.91 and Friday's opening price of $141.06, was the biggest gap since the 11.8% downside gap between the Oct. 27, 2022 close ($110.96) and the Oct. 28 open ($97.91) after a disappointing holiday-season sales and profit outlook.

title: Amazon.com analysts boost target price on 2Q beat and record gross margin
text: Wedbush analysts believe Amazon.com, Inc took “its foot off the gas pedal” on some of the spending in order to deliver higher profitability during its second quarter of 2023, calling it a “prudent decision” and a “page out of the Bezos Playbook”.   In a note to clients, they raised their 12-month target price on the stock to $170 per share from $146, while maintaining an ‘Outperform' rating, following the eCommerce giant's better-than-expected 2Q revenue and earnings on record gross margin.

title: Amazon, Apple, Airbnb, Starbucks, Ferrari and other earnings that moved markets this week
Amazon Music teams up with Bandsintown to let fans shop merch from popular artists
text: Amazon Music announced a new merch integration with concert discovery platform Bandsintown to allow more than 590,000 artists to promote their merchandise on the Bandsintown website and app. Previously, artists could only link their Shopify store.

title: Amazon's (AMZN) Q2 Earnings & Sales Beat Estimates, Up Y/Y
text: Amazon's (AMZN) second-quarter results reflect strength in AWS, Prime, third-party sellers and advertising businesses.

title: Amazon's Big Quarter Drives Up Cloud Software Stocks
text: The tech giant posted 12% growth for Amazon Web Services in the June quarter, surpassing Street expectations.

title: Markets Higher Midday After Upbeat Earnings, July Jobs Report
text: U.S. equities were higher at midday on Friday, Aug. 4, 2023 on the back of strong earnings reports, while a cooler-than-expected July jobs report raised optimism the Fed could ease back on its campaign of rate hikes to cool inflation.

title: July Jobs Cool to 187K, Unemployment Drops to 3.5%
text: Year over year, hourly wages remain elevated at +4.4%, 20 basis points (bps) higher than analysts were looking for.

title: Amazon stock rockets 11%, on pace for best day since November after blowout quarter
text: Analysts cheered stabilizing AWS growth, improving retail margins, and progress on cutting costs.

title: Why Amazon.com Stock Soared Today
text: Amazon easily exceeded both its own guidance and Wall Street's expectations in Q2. Growth was broad-based across North America, International, and AWS.

title: 5 ETFs to Profit from Amazon's Q2 Earnings Beat
text: Amazon (AMZN) reported robust second-quarter results, wherein it beat both earnings and revenue estimates. The e-commerce giant provided an upbeat revenue outlook for the ongoing quarter.

title: Amazon's stock is now a better play than Apple's, according to this analyst
text: Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +11.20% and Apple Inc. AAPL, -2.78% each reported earnings Thursday, and those results prompted Rosenblatt Securities analyst Barton Crockett to change his tune on both names. He upgraded Amazon's stock to buy from neutral after earnings, while making the reverse move on shares of Apple.

title: Amazon Stock Hits 12-Month High On Impressive Sales Boost—Pushing Bezos' Net Worth Up $12 Billion
text: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' net worth increased around $200 million per minute in the first hour of trading Friday.

title: Amazon Revamps Grocery Business; Makes Biggest Changes Since Acquiring Whole Foods In 2017
text: Six years ago, Amazon closed its $13.7 billion purchase of Whole Foods Market, by far the biggest acquisition ever for the e-commerce and cloud computing giant.

title: Upbeat Earnings Boost Amazon.com Stock
text: Amazon.com Inc's (NASDAQ:AMZN) highly anticipated second-quarter report bested analyst estimates, with profits of 65 cents per share on revenue of $134.38 billion.

title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says 'every single one' of its teams is working on generative AI projects as the company rushes to keep pace with the AI boom
text: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says the company is working on multiple generative AI projects. The CEO called AI a "significant investment and focus" for the company.

title: "Big Tech" Earnings Review: ETFs in Focus
text: Among the top five big tech stocks, Amazon, Facebook-parent Meta and Google-parent Alphabet delivered impressive results, garnering positive reactions from investors, while Apple and Microsoft disappointed investors.

title: Amazon CEO To Wait And See If Store Remodels Produce Desired Results
text: Time will tell, but Amazon's me-too approach to designing and running grocery stores suggests that any improvements coming will likely only delivery minor incremental

title: Everyone's Watching These 2 Stocks Friday Morning
text: Markets inched higher in premarket trading. Amazon's stock got a big boost as both its e-commerce and cloud infrastructure businesses performed well.

title: DataDog: Stock Soars After Amazon's Strong AWS Results
text: DataDog's stock surged in after hours trading on Thursday following Amazon's release of stronger than expected Q2 AWS results: $22.1 billion in revenue (+12% yoy). DDOG - a provider of cloud monitoring, security, and data analytics tools - also announced a bevy of new products at its annual DASH conference this week. AI is a strong positive catalyst for DDOG going forward as companies must migrate to the cloud in order to ring-out the most from AI algorithms.

title: Nasdaq set to get Amazon boost but non-farm payrolls loom
text: US markets are indicated to open modestly higher, with Amazon a likely big riser, although much will depend on non-farm payrolls data before Wall Street opens. Futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average are one point higher, those for the S&P 500 are 7 points to the good while Nasdaq futures are up 31 points.

title: Amazon Stock Jumps After Earnings Beat, Ad Revenues Offset Slower Cloud Growth
text: Amazon shares jumped after the company reported stronger than expected earnings, with robust ad revenue helping to offset slower growth in cloud.

title: Amazon Is One Thing. But This Stock Market Bellwether Is Flashing Red for U.S. Tech.
text: Results from advertising behemoth WPP reveal a slowdown in spending from clients in the U.S. technology sector. It could be an early sign.

title: Trading Game Plan: Jobs report, AAPL & AMZN earnings, day trades, swing trades and trading education - August 04, 2023
text: (Kitco News) - In today's action-packed session of the Game Plan LIVE on YouTube, Gareth Soloway will offer a full overview key charts and data sets across all markets. This includes a look at the Jobs Report, AAPL & AMZN Earnings, Day Trades, Swing Trades and Trading Education.

title: Amazon Stood Out. Why Analysts Think It Will Keep Delivering.
text: Analysts raised their target prices on Amazon after its earnings, seeing revenue momentum in cloud computing and improving e-commerce margins.

title: After Reporting A 2022 Loss, Amazon Looks To Rekindle Growth And Regain Its Mojo
text: E-commerce and cloud-computing leader Amazon.com has much to prove as it attempts to regain its mojo.

title: 5 Things to Know Before Markets Open
text: Job growth is projected to slow and Amazon shares are soaring after the ecommerce giant blew by analyst revenue expectations. Here's what investors need to know today.

title: How Amazon's ‘game-changing' earnings could unlock a sustained stock surge
text: Amazon.com Inc. showed positive momentum on the two most controversial elements of its story Thursday, and analysts were quick to shower the company with praise as a result.

title: Amazon Expands One-Day Delivery
text: Same day delivery for some items is already in 90 metropolitan areas, according to the company.

title: Amazon touts artificial intelligence products, services for businesses
text: Tech giant Amazon held its Q2 earnings call on Thursday as executives touted its AI initiatives, including the Bedrock platform businesses can use to make AI tools and models.

title: Amazon Is Flying on the Cloud. AWS Jumps.
text: Stronger-than-expected growth from the company's cloud business offers hope that a recent slowdown is over. Shares of Amazon and other cloud players jumped on the news.

title: Amazon shares pop but Apple's dip, and other movers
text: Amazon.com Inc.‘s stock AMZN, +0.55% jumped more than 8% after the retail juggernaut blew past second-quarter expectations, with strong e-commerce and cloud sales.

title: Amazon Shines During Apple's Off-Season
text: One tech titan snaps its growth slump, while the other remains mired in it.

title: U.S. stock futures rise ahead of jobs report and mixed reaction to Amazon and Apple results
text: U.S. stock futures rose Friday ahead of the key jobs report, as traders gave a mixed reception to results from Amazon.com and Apple.

title: Amazon and Apple beat earnings forecasts as they polish AI skills
text: Amazon and Apple on Thursday reported earnings that topped market expectations, aiming for even better days ahead with the help of artificial intelligence (AI).

title: Amazon shares jump after results top estimates
text: Amazon.com Inc shares were lifted after hours, following the technology giant's strong post-close second-quarter results. Revenue rose 11% year over year to $134.4 billion, Amazon reported after Thursday's close, surpassing the $131.5 billion consensus compiled by Refinitiv.
